item.title: Report E-2023060802
item.description:
Report E-2023060802

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-20T21:09:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-09
  • City: CONSTANTINE
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SCHNEIDER NATIONAL BULK CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: To be clear, there was nothing wrong with the valves on our trailer, I just didn't know what to flag on number 25. That said our driver hooked up to the right fill line at the customer (nitric acid) but then when he turned around to our trailer he ended up to the wrong compartment which contained sodium hydroxide. He admits that he didn't do a final check like they are trained to do. When he started to unload smoke quickly formed from the customer tank. He shut down. The reaction caused approximately 10 gallons to leak on to the concrete floor. A clean up crew was hired to come in and clean up the floor and empty the tank when the reaction subsided.
